pageContext.claim: “And I remember when I signed [the termination of the Waters of the United States rule], I had a lot of people -- a lot of farmers and construction workers and a lot of people behind me. And these are people that didn't cry when they were babies. They would — never cried in their life, and they were crying. They would -- never cried in their life, and they were crying. A lot of them were crying because I gave them their land back.”
pageContext.analysis: Video of the signing ceremony shows that no one is crying.
